posts.cooked:
Wanting to know if There is a plan in the future to use the system sounds that the user sets or creates. Example I create a ringtone in Garage band on my IOS device. I then export that as a ringtone on my IOS device. I can then set that new Ringtone as a notification sound or what ever sound I would like from the Sounds & Haptics menu within settings on my IOS device.

not sure what Signal is written in or if IOS allows you to use system settings as described. Would this be possible?

link_counts.title: Add ability to customize ringtone for calls

posts.cooked: Why does the Notification Message Sound picker does not allow to pick custom sounds? I have some custom stored Ringtones which can be used in other applications but not in Signal

Well, hello there!

I recently switched from Android to iOS and stand somewhat flabbergasted that in iOS the 13 preset notification sounds (Note, Aurora, Bamboo, Chord, Circles, Complete, Hello, Input, Keys, Popcorn, Pulse, Signal Classic, Synth) are not related to the standard iOS notifications and no custom notifications are allowed.

Why is that?

Any privacy reason in iOS but not in Android?

Please offer this standard feature in iOS as well (as it exists in Android)!

(And while doing that, please offer a customization for the ringtone as well! Again: Android has it, but iOS does not?)

Cheers! raimerik

posts.name: Jo
posts.cooked:
I was using an Android phone earlier and moved to iPhone iOS13
Missing few nice features in iPhone compared to Android

  • Custom notification options (ringtones and sounds)
  • Color code for contacts (message highlight for each contacts)

Thanks!

Signal will never be a mainstream IM app on iOS if the user cannot customize the notification tone. This is a must feature for a messenger app. Right now Signal is offering even less of a choice than even the iOS defaults as the Classic-group of notification sounds is missing alltogether. The Classic-grouped notification tones are included in iOS by default and are available in every IM app other than Signal.

The first post on this thread was made on 08/2019 and six months later Signal is still missing this basic feature.

Agree. My default Signal notification sound on iPhone 11 is a single “ding” sound which means I often miss the arrival of a new Signal. If I can’t rely on getting signals, I would regrettably be forced to use another messaging app. PLEASE fix!

To fix that problems for now just pick the signal classic as a sound so you’ll be able to hear the differences between normal notifications and signal notifications should make it easier to differentiate at least until they add more customization.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Since Signal iOS 3.18, it is possible to set custom notification sounds (note that only .aiff , .wav and .caf are supported):

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.18 release
  • You can now select custom tones for notifications (thanks to public contributor @Topheee)
github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS

Added custom notification sounds

committed 09:54PM - 23 Sep 20 UTC
Topheee
+324 -120

* user can add custom notification sounds from Files app (aiff, wav, or caf file…s) * former OWSSound enum is now named OWSStandardSound, OWSSound turned into an alias for NSUInteger * custom sounds get IDs based on the hash of the file name

Regarding custom ringtones, I believe the situation is still:

Add ability to customize ringtone for calls Android Feature Requests
On iOS, Signal calls respect the system’s default ringtone. Signal iOS will also use any custom ringtone that you have assigned to a contact in the iOS Contacts app.

link_counts.title: Added custom notification sounds · signalapp/Signal-iOS@4715240 · GitHub
Add ability to customize ringtone for calls
